Hello  		Hello,
 
The Banca Unione di Credito here in Switzerland, is one of the Largest Swiss banks licensed to operate Private banking in Switzerland.

My Name is Adrian Muster; and I used to work at the Banca Unione di Credito in Switzerland.

As an Investment manager with the bank, I have handled a lot of secret, tax free, investments offshore, which are not traceable for our numerous international private clients, which include Americans, Africans and Asians in line with their instructions. Because of the secrets and personal nature of these Investments we must work one on one with the clients to ensure full confidentiality.
 
The real purpose for contacting you is that, I have a very small proposition and I need your cooperation.

Eight years ago a client I worked with, a Mr. John de Balint; a Yugoslavian Oil Trader with Yukos Oil in Russia invested a lot of money in 4 different time deposit accounts, each for a 4 year period in our Offshore B ank in the Cayman Islands.

Before the maturity of these innvestments, the Bank was informed by the police; of his death in an oilrig explosion.
 		
At the time of his death he left a Will and the Will stated that his only son (Who is in jail, in Sri Lanka for drug offences on a 25-year sentence), was the only beneficiary to all his assets. Legally, the son cannot make the claim, so there is no next-of-kin to claim the funds.

The Funds have been dormant for the last 36 months and by the instructions here at our Switzerland head office, it will be declared unclaimed by the bank very soon.
 
I just retired from the bank and I have spoken to Mr. John de BalintÕs son about this proposal also. I am therefore compelled to seek your cooperation to salvage the investments for the son and the rest for the both of us. I have decided to contact you and provide you with the necessary documents and assistances so you can claim the funds as the next of Kin to Mr. John de Balint.

The son will also be confirming your identity to the bank, as a known person to him and the funds will be transferred to you, because he cannot claim it himself, as the law forbids anyone currently associated with such criminal charges to make such a claim and if these funds are not claimed soon; they will be deposited into the Swiss Treasury as unclaimed funds. If this happens, no one can make claim to the money again.

You will have to hold 80% in lieu for the son and the balance can be shared between us based on our agreement.

Please respond immediately via any of my secure email addresses below indicating your interest or otherwise, and more details and relevant documents that will help you understand my proposition and how to proceed.

  adrian.muster@lugano.com
 
 I am looking forward to your response and
cooperation.
 
 Respectfully,
 
 Adrian Muster.

-- adrian.muster45@Safe-mail.net wrote:
Dear Friend,

Thank you for the e-mail response to my proposal.

I will like to put you through all the steps to make
this deal conclusive and sucsessful for all of us.I
don't know you and you don't
know me, but i would like to confide and trust in
you as the success of this deal is very crutial.

One thing i will like you to do is to keep in touch
regularly and respond to all my e-mails within 24-36
hours Or else i will conclude that you are no longer
interested in helping me claim the funds.

When Mr. John de Balint died, his accounts (4
accounts) were added to a list of dormant account
here in Switzerland.These accounts were viewedas
Dormant after 3 years when his only son,who is
serving a life imprisonment term in Sri-lanka for
drug trafficking was not deemed responsible to place
the claim.

The database where this account was added can be
accessed at http://www.crt-ii.org/search.phtm The
deceased account holders name and surname can be
used as the search criteria.

As of the time of Mr. John de Balint's death, i used
to work at the Zurich branch of Banca Unione Di
Credito, but i was transferred to the Geneva
branch., a few years after the transfer i retired.

I have the original copy of the deceased Death
Certificate which was provided to me by the
deceased's sons' attorney after my visit to him in
the Sri-lankan prison.He has agreed with my proposal
as i put it to you and that is why i contacted you
and i am looking for a reliable partner.

The total sum held in the term deposits plus
interests amounts to $ USD 80.25 million (US
Currency). My proposal is that 80% of this will be
for the son and the other 20% will be for the both
of us to share.I offer you 5% and i will take
15%(this is however negotiable on further
discussion).

I have already given the deceased son an upfront
garauntte sum of $ USD 100,000.00 for the release of
his fathers Death Certificate to me, which will be
required when claiming Mr. John de Balint's assets
in your name, as the next-of-kin.

The next step to proceed is to fill out the
necessary cliam forms and also get an attorney to
represent all legal matters at the bank. 50% of the
attorney fees will be paid by myself and the other
50% by you.I don't have too much on me as of the
moment and this is why i suggest this. A good
attorney here in Switzerland cost at least Euro
2,600.00, but i will inquire further on this after i
get your concent.

Not to worry, the bank will not ask you for your
relation to the deceased, but they will contact the
son and confirm your identity.On your agreement, I
will provide you access to all forms and documents
and i will also proceed to Sri-lanka and inform his
son on the developments.

If you are ready to move with all these proceeds Or
if you wish not to continue, please do inform me.I
have to make the meeting with the attorneys and also
make the trip to Sri-lanka soon, so i need to know.

I request strict confidentiality from you on this
matter and i will be very humbly obliged if you did
not provide any information on this deal to anyone.

After i gain your trust and i think we can work
together as partner, i will reveal my true identity
to you.Please do understand that i am trying to
protect my interest by using a false name on my
first contact to you.

Kindly respond with 24-36 hours if you are
interested in proceeding Or not.If i do not get a
response from you by then, i will cease from
contacting you again.

Best Regards,

Adrian

May 16

My dear Musterd,

Thank you for your note.

We are a little perturbed by this development, if not
for the content of the post-script but for the
security implications.

Do you realize the ramifications if these soundrels
hack into your e-mail? Do see that this doesn't happen
again. We simply cannot afford a repeat of the Bowden
Affair. 

To business, then. Whilst we are prepared to continue
this transaction, in light of these recent
developments we shall require you to sign a Temporary
Oath of Allegiance to Her Majesty, so we can ensure
that you are not only a professional, decent and
honest businessman but that your intentions towards
Her Majesty's Government are totally honourable.

If you are prepared to do this, I shall send you the
text forthwith.

My dear Adrian (if I may),

Thank you for your note. We are delighted that you
have taken these security precautions.

Dr. Shipman and myself will adhere to this business to
your specification - have no fear that we will ensure
that you'll get what you deserve, come what may.

To the oath, then: please type out the following text,
include your picture, date and sign it and send it
back to me after you have recited it:

"On this day.............I, Adrian Muster, do by
humble merkin swear in all Pro Vas Deferens to assist
Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II in all fey twiglets
pertaining to he right Royal business. Pro Vom
Poppadom." 

We look forward to receiving your Oath.

As ever,

Lady Agatha Bristol, CBE
Head of Special Operations, Foreign Office, London

May 17

My dear Adrian,

Come come, old chap. 

That we have seen through your pathetic attempt at a
419 scam from the beginning shows what a pathetic,
greedy, revolting little man you are.

However, though you are a despicable mugu, we
acknowledge that you have recognized the joke - and in
doing so what a stupid, senseless ghastly tribesman
you really are.

We look forward to crossing swords with you again - in
another guise, of course. Our Agents are everywhere.
Sooner or later we'll find you. 

Congratulations - you've been given the treatment by
the Special Operations Department.

And we'll be back to finish the job. 

Soon.

As ever,

Lady Agatha Bristol, CBE
Head of Special Operations, Foreign Office, London
